name: Personal Log-Day 1
description: DISASTER! As we egressed the complex, a large section of the underground tunnels collapsed behind us, leaving my team isolated from our equipment, supplies, and the rest of our personnel.

quests.name: Questing Tutorial
quests.description: PLEASE READ ALL THE TEXT OF THIS QUEST CAREFULLY! This quest explains how to do quests. Scroll down to read all the text. This text area always applies to the quest as a whole. Everywhere but in this quest this is in-world flavor text. Explanations of a quest's tasks you'll find on the opposite page, Click on a task to see its text on the opposite page.

tasks.longDescription: This text area usually contains standardized text like "A task where the player has to craft specific items". If a task needs special instructions beyond that, they will appear here. This is a crafting task. Crafting these items in anything that works like a normal crafting table will count - like AE2 crafting terminals or TiC crafting stations, but autocrafting does not count. Now craft a quest delivery system. Your quest book will not be consumed in its crafting

A task where the player needs specific items. These do not have to be handed in, having them in one's inventory is enough. <== this is the standardized text. Detection tasks are used if the player must acquire specific items, but it is not possible to craft them in a crafting table. How they are acquired does not matter. If you took the quest delivery system you crafted in the previous task into your inventory, this task should already be marked completed. Detection tasks for more than one item of the same kind stay at 0% until you have the full number required in your inventory. If the quest condition is apparently fulfilled but not marked, use the "manual detect" button. If that does not work, the quest objective is not fulfilled.

A task where the player has to kill certain monsters. <== this is the standardized text. I believe this task needs no further explanation. Go kill a cow. Hint: this may prove more dangerous than you're used to.

A task where the player has to reach one or more locations. <== This is the standardized text. Go to the location specified below. In this task your goal is simply the overworld, and since you are already there, the task is marked as completed. Specific coordinates may appear in a location quest.

A task where the player can hand in items or fluids. One can also use the Quest Delivery System to submit items and fluids. <== This is the standard text. You can manually submit items to a consume task using the "Manual Submit" button below, or use the QDS. To use the QDS, select "select task" below, close the questbook and then right-click on the QDS with it. After that, you can pipe in items or fluids. Items and fluids piped into a wrong task or an unmarked QDS will be lost without benefit, so be careful.

quests.name: Doing it harder
quests.description: One advantage we have over primitive cultures is that we know how to extract metals even from the poorest of sources. Our first machine will be a sluice, which will help us filter out heavy metals from the surrounding sand and gravel.

quests.name: Shelter for the Night
quests.description: There's not much we can do about those still in cryosleep inside the bunker -- even if they're still alive. There will be time later for grief. Right now, we need to focus on getting the basics: food, clothing, and shelter. Chop down some trees and dig out a shelter for the night. WARNING: Digging a shelter too big will cause the roof to collapse.

quests.name: Lay down your weary head
quests.description: The emergency sleeping bags we brought will work good when we're away from our shelter, but we're going to need a more long-term solution to sleeping at night -- and that means wool. Craft a carpenter's bed and door.

quests.name: Sluicing
quests.description: In order to get the sluice to work, we need to place the four sluice blocks down in a row, with 8 identical wood planks lining the sides of the sluice (4 on each side). Using the bucket, we can then place water in the block immediately next to the head of the sluice. Last, placing the hopper over the head of the sluice will allow us some rudimentary automation. Place sand or gravel in the sluice to generate metal dusts.

tasks.longDescription: NOTE: Keep your eye out for the poorjoe flower. It grows near undergroun iron deposits. The kind of ore in your chunk of the world determines what ores you'll get out of the sluice!

A task where the player needs specific items. These do not have to be handed in, having them in one's inventory is enough. NOTE, sand will yield more tiny piles of dust than gravel, but you'll get more ore overall from gravel

quests.name: Out of the stone age!
quests.description: It took our ancestors thousands of years to make it out of the stone age. We did it in just a couple of days. Now that we have the materials, let's craft some iron tools to make our lives easier. Also, Smith found Jones' ammo bag in the rubble at the entrance with a few more M9 clips.

quests.name: Tilting spears at windmills
quests.description: I've always wanted to say that, and it looks like I finally have the opportunity. Using a little wind power, we can automate some refining of these ores before we smelt them.

tasks.longDescription: See the in-game guide (located to the left of your inventory screen) for instructions on building the multiblock windmill.
